DOCNAME: CASE OF TRE TRAKTÖRER AKTIEBOLAG v. SWEDEN
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;No violation of P1-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant , PERSON ( " TTA " ) , is a NORP limited company with its seat at GPE , GPE . Its sole shareholder is PERSON .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE TTA took over the management of the restaurant FAC in GPE and obtained on DATE a licence to serve beer , wine and miscellaneous alcoholic beverages .

CARDINAL . ORG FAC had been opened on DATE by PERSON , which had obtained a licence on CARDINAL DATE . This company , which had been formed in DATE , had been bought on DATE by PERSON . She was also its sole shareholder until DATE . She retained the majority of the shares until DATE and was a full or deputy member of the board until DATE . The company was apparently sold in DATE .

CARDINAL . TTA ’s licence for ORG remained in force until DATE , when it was replaced by a new licence which was subject to the condition that the business retained the character of a restaurant . This in turn was replaced on CARDINAL DATE by a fresh licence to which were attached new regulations with regard to the serving of young people .

CARDINAL . ORG In DATE ORG ( PERSON ) of GPE had carried out an inspection on ORG activities DATE and DATE . During this period PERSON had at various times managed CARDINAL different establishments , including the restaurant FAC . The inspection , on the basis of which an audit report was drawn up on DATE , had revealed various inaccuracies in the book - keeping ; the most significant discrepancy , estimated at CARDINAL NORP crowns ( SEK ) , concerned the sale of beers , wines and spirits in that restaurant DATE and DATE . The total turnover of the company during this period was QUANTITY .
CARDINAL . ORG As a result of the audit report the assessment of PERSON personal taxable income for DATE was increased by CARDINAL SEK .
On DATE , however , ORG ( Länsrätten ) reduced this amount to CARDINAL and the local tax department in GPE issued the corresponding reassessment notice ( omräkningsbesked ) .

CARDINAL . ORG As a further result of the audit report , criminal proceedings were also instituted against PERSON under section QUANTITY on Tax Offences ( skattebrottslagen ) for having , as a representative of PERSON , deliberately or through gross negligence disregarded her book - keeping obligations and thereby seriously hindered control by DATE authorities ( försvårande av skattekontroll ) . In the course of the hearing and in the light of the evidence presented , the prosecution reduced the scope of the charges it had originally brought on DATE .

On DATE ORG ( Tingsrätten ) of GPE acquitted her on the following grounds : it was not established either that the result of the calculations concerning alcohol and tobacco could be explained by book - keeping mistakes , or that the discrepancies regarding the period from DATE , which were due to the absence of a cash register , had been caused deliberately or through gross negligence ; and the other alleged discrepancies could not be considered to be of such a nature and extent as seriously to hinder control , within the meaning of the said section CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . ORG In DATE TTA requested from ORG an extension of TIME at FAC from TIME until TIME The request was forwarded on CARDINAL DATE to ORG ( socialnämnden ) and to ORG ( polisstyrelsen ) of GPE for their observations .

On DATE ORG submitted a negative opinion , on the basis of a complaint filed against PERSON by the tax authority ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) ; in its opinion , her capacity to deal with the serving of alcoholic beverages was open to doubt . ORG likewise expressed a negative opinion on DATE .

After TTA had been given the opportunity to file its own observations , ORG decided on DATE to postpone its ruling on the request until it had finally determined whether the company could be considered fit to hold a licence to serve alcoholic beverages .

CARDINAL . ORG The audit report of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) had been communicated to the competent section of ORG and , on DATE , it informed TTA of its contents . ORG stated that it was considering withdrawing the licence to serve alcoholic beverages under section FAC ) of LAW on GPE ( lagen om handel med drycker - " LAW " ; see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and invited observations before DATE .

After ORG had filed observations , its representatives produced the current books of the company to ORG . They stated that the discrepancies as regards the sale of alcoholic beverages were due to thefts .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG decided to issue an admonition under LAW of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The decision stated , inter alia :

" In view of what was established during the audit and as the company has not been able to explain the discrepancies satisfactorily , ORG finds that there are reasons to revoke the licence under LAW of LAW . Accordingly , it ought to be revoked now . The only argument against a revocation is that the negligence took place in DATE , that is DATE . As far as has been ascertained , no criticism has been levelled against the management of the restaurant thereafter . Against this background , ORG has not found it necessary to revoke the licence . Instead it issues a serious admonition against the company pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW . "
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG renewed until further notice ORG ’s previous licence , dated DATE . The renewed licence contained , on its reverse side , the following special conditions :
" REGULATIONS
CARDINAL . This licence is not transferable .
CARDINAL . There must be a person responsible for serving ....
CARDINAL . Alcoholic beverages may not be served unless the person responsible or his or her substitute is present ....
CARDINAL . Any change of activity should be reported to ORG ....
CARDINAL . This licence or a copy thereof shall be exhibited in the restaurant .

CARDINAL . The activities shall be carried on in such a way as not to be aimed at a young public , i.e. DATE . The licence - holder is therefore obliged to take this into account , inter alia when advertising .

ORG recalls that the licence has been granted on the assumption that the provision of cooked food will be a major part of the business and that the company , in accordance with its ‘ ORG , does not intend to run a discotheque . It is further noted that the company has undertaken to discourage too young a clientele by its choice of music and by not playing recorded music .
ORG orders that serving shall end at TIME "

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG appealed to ORG ( socialstyrelsen ) against this decision and requested that the licence be revoked . The ORG referred to the results of the audit and to the fact that the special conditions accompanying the licence had not been complied with .

In the latter respect the ORG relied on the report of an inspection carried out at the restaurant on CARDINAL DATE . This revealed , inter alia , that the restaurant was then overcrowded , many customers not having seats ; that most of the customers , whose ages ranged from CARDINAL to DATE , were DATE ; and that in the upper part of the premises there was a discotheque which was open TIME . According to the conditions of the licence , there was to be live dance - music and activities were to be aimed at young people above DATE .
On DATE the applicant company was given an opportunity to file observations on the appeal . It did so on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . After reciting the contents of section CARDINAL ) and of section CARDINAL ) ( as amended in DATE ) of LAW ( see paragraphs CARDINAL below ) , it gave the following reasons :

" The provisions of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the DATE Act are connected , inter alia , with the requirement in section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act that a new holder of a licence must be suitable . This requirement of suitability has in practice been considered to include a requirement of personal suitability to sell alcoholic beverages , an activity involving great social responsibility . As regards companies , this requirement is applicable to those individuals who have a considerable influence on the business .

The unsuitability of the licence - holder which constitutes a reason for revoking the licence may be of many different types . In the PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL : CARDINAL , page CARDINAL , economic mismanagement , even if it is not criminal , is given as CARDINAL example of personal unsuitability .
According to section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act , the book - keeping of a business involved in the sale of alcoholic beverages must be such as to permit control of the business .

In the instant case ORG referred to an audit report as the basis for its decision . From this report it appears that the book - keeping of PERSON was deficient in several respects . For instance , there are differences to be found concerning the recorded sale of beverages . The explanations given by the company regarding , inter alia , thefts of such beverages show , in the opinion of ORG , that those who have had a decisive influence on the business have failed to demonstrate sufficient competence regarding both book - keeping and internal control . LAW of LAW is therefore applicable in this case .

ORG finds that the deficiencies concern compliance with section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act and , as far as suitability is concerned , are of such a nature that a measure other than revocation of the licence can not be considered . The fact that in the instant case ORG has rejected the charges of hindering a tax investigation does not affect this assessment .
In view of the above the appeal is allowed .
ORG quashes the decision under appeal and refers the matter back for further action . "
This decision was not open to appeal .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG of GPE decided to revoke , with immediate effect , ORG ’s licence to serve alcoholic beverages . The company states that , as a result , the restaurant had to be closed down on DATE . However , this was disputed by the Government .

CARDINAL . TTA appealed to ORG , requesting that the decision to revoke the licence should take effect as from DATE . The company stated that it would otherwise be faced with financial problems on account of the applicable periods of notice for the staff .

On DATE ORG rejected the appeal . It considered that , having regard to its previous decision , there were no reasons to depart from the general rule in CARDINAL of the DATE Act that decisions under that LAW should take effect immediately . This decision was not open to appeal .

CARDINAL . ORG By letter of DATE , the applicant company submitted to the Government a claim for compensation based on the decision to revoke the licence . It requested the Government to find that the decision of ORG violated the company ’s rights under LAW . It further alleged that NORP law had been incorrectly applied .

On DATE the Government decided to refer the claim for compensation to the Chancellor of ORG ( justitiekanslern ) and not to take any measures in the matter as regards the other issues . On DATE the Chancellor of ORG expressed the opinion that the claim for compensation should be rejected ; he found no indication that any authority had committed any error which could make the ORG liable under LAW DATE ( skadeståndslagen ; see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . ORG In DATE FAC was sold for MONEY .

CARDINAL . ORG The aim of NORP policy as regards alcohol is to limit its total consumption and to counteract its abuse and the resultant damage to health . Restrictions on alcohol in GPE are of long standing . Since DATE restaurants and bars serving alcoholic beverages have had to be licensed , and in DATE a ORG monopoly was introduced for wholesale and retail trading in alcohol . These restrictions remain in force .

The present LAW was adopted in DATE and regulates trading in beer , wine and liquor . It also lays down rules on the serving of these beverages for consumption on the premises of restaurants and bars as well as on the issuing of licences for and inspection of these LOC . The LAW is supplemented by an Ordinance on the Sale of Beverages ( förordning om handel med drycker ) .
CARDINAL . ORG Alcoholic beverages may be served only if a licence has been issued ( section CARDINAL of the DATE Act ) . In this respect , section CARDINAL provides :
" In examining whether to issue a licence special regard should be had to the need for the restaurant , the applicant ’s suitability and the suitability of the premises for the purpose . "

Licences are issued by ORG in the county where the LOC are situated . When the application concerns a new establishment for the serving of alcoholic beverages , ORG has to consult the local municipal council ( kommunfullmäktige ) and the local police authority before a decision is taken . Even in cases concerning the transfer of licences to new owners , extended serving - hours and the revocation of licences ORG may consult these local authorities .

ORG has to inform the local ORG of its decisions concerning the serving of alcoholic beverages . For their part , ORG and the police have to inform ORG of such circumstances as may be relevant in connection with the application of LAW .

CARDINAL . ORG Both the local authorities and the persons concerned may appeal to ORG against decisions taken by ORG under LAW . The decisions of ORG in these matters are final ( section CARDINAL of the Act ) . Furthermore , ORG supervises the implementation of the LAW and the LAW at national level .
CARDINAL . ORG Until DATE , section CARDINAL of the DATE Act provided as follows :

" CARDINAL . The licensing authority shall revoke the licence or limit it to certain beverages where such sale of alcoholic beverages as takes place under a licence according to this LAW causes annoyance relating to public order , drunkenness or disturbance of the peace or where the provisions of this LAW or the conditions imposed under it are not complied with . If it may be assumed that a satisfactory situation can be achieved without such a severe measure , the licence - holder may instead be given an admonition or special instructions .
CARDINAL . The first paragraph also applies , mutatis mutandis , if the conditions for granting a licence are no longer satisfied .
CARDINAL . In cases covered by the first or the second paragraph the approval of a director or a substitute director may be withdrawn . "
CARDINAL . ORG The second paragraph of LAW was amended in DATE ( SFS CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) ; as from DATE , it has read as follows :

" The first paragraph also applies when the licence - holder can no longer be considered suitable to sell alcoholic beverages or when for other reasons the conditions for granting a licence are no longer satisfied . "

In this connection , the ORG ’s PERSON ( p. CARDINAL ) referred to recent complaints filed before ORG concerning revocation of licences on account of economic mismanagement by the licensee . The PERSON also stated ( p. CARDINAL ) that the amendment would make it clearer that economic mismanagement may be a reason for considering the licence - holder unsuitable , even if the sale of alcoholic beverages has been carried out in conformity with the applicable legislation . Only considerable economic mismanagement is relevant in this connection . Anyone who systematically mismanages the payment of taxes and contributions or seriously disregards his obligations regarding book - keeping or the supplying of information shall be considered unsuitable to hold a licence . It is , however , not a condition that the mismanagement is criminal or even intentional . A considerable degree of negligence in the performance of these obligations can also constitute sufficient reason for intervention .
CARDINAL . ORG With regard to book - keeping , section CARDINAL of the DATE LAW provides as follows :

" The book - keeping of an establishment which carries on the sale of alcoholic beverages shall be so organised as to permit control of the activities . The manager of the establishment is obliged to produce the books of the establishment at the request of the licensing authority . He is also obliged to produce statistical information pursuant to the regulations issued by the ORG or , after the ORG ’s decision , by ORG . "
The travaux préparatoires of section CARDINAL state that unsatisfactory book - keeping is in itself proof of unsuitability to conduct a business involving the sale of alcoholic beverages .

CARDINAL . ORG In DATE a report on the NORP legislation on the sale of beverages was drawn up under terms of reference issued by the Government ( ORG CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) . Its author proposed that decisions in this area by ORG should be open to appeal to ORG . He considered that it was not appropriate for ORG , which was vested with supervisory functions under LAW , to fulfil an appellate role , such a task being more suitably performed by the administrative courts . This proposal was subsequently submitted for examination to the competent Ministry .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG adopted an LAW concerning appeals against administrative decisions . This LAW came into effect on DATE and will remain in force until DATE . It entitles individuals to have certain decisions of administrative authorities brought before ORG in order to establish whether the decisions were in accordance with the law .
CARDINAL . ORG Under LAW , section CARDINAL , of LAW DATE , the ORG is liable to pay compensation in the event of fault or negligence in the exercise of authority ( myndighetsutövning ) .
